definition: to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: People call him bad breath because he is ugly.
sentences.chinese: 人們叫他討厭鬼就是因爲他很醜。

sentences.english: Tom is a booger, so no one wants to play with him.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆是個討厭鬼，沒人願意和他玩。

sentences.english: I don't want to see that creep again.
sentences.chinese: 我不想再見那個討厭鬼了。

sentences.english: But as players in the euro-zone crisis, the British are viewed with head-shaking exasperation.
sentences.chinese: 但在歐元危機中，它卻被看作是難以取悅的討厭鬼。

sentences.english: Oh, Potter, you rotter , oh what have you done?
sentences.chinese: 哦，波特，你這個討厭鬼，看你做的好事。

sentences.english: You are a bad breath, and I dislike you.
sentences.chinese: 你個討厭鬼，我不喜歡你。

sentences.english: Oh yeah, well I see you as a jerk.
sentences.chinese: 噢，是呀，我看你就是個討厭鬼。

sentences.english: He is a booger, everybody stays away from him.
sentences.chinese: 他是個討厭鬼，每個人都離他遠遠的。

sentences.english: Pardon my French, but he is a bloody nuisance!
sentences.chinese: 很原諒我要說粗口，但是他真的是個討厭鬼。

sentences.english: The South Atlantic Anomaly is well known as a thorough nuisance.
sentences.chinese: 南太平洋磁異常區一直以十足的討厭鬼著稱。

sentences.english: The dog is a terrible nuisance.
